Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Illinois governor-elect J.B. Pritzker and other Democratic state legislators proposed a "departing taxpayer fee." The spokesperson for Pritzker confirmed that the claim was "absolutely not true."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove its validity. The expert found no evidence to suggest that Pritzker had ever floated the idea of charging residents a special tax assessment for moving out of the state.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Pritzker and other Democratic state legislators proposed a "departing taxpayer fee" without providing any credible sources or evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the claim may be a hoax or an unflagged attempt at satire, indicating that there could be alternative explanations for the circulation of this false information.
